decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing cards that cycle through the deck quickly and efficiently to accelerate towards casting Living End, which allows you to cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield at a discounted cost. The creatures in the deck are chosen specifically to synergize with Living End, creating a strong combo that can overwhelm opponents quickly. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation to protect the combo and ensure its success. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to efficiently cycle through cards to set up a game-winning Living End combo.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful colorless threats such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine. It also utilizes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt opponent's strategy. The inclusion of The One Ring as an alternate win condition adds versatility to the deck. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game with powerful threats and disruption while ramping into game-winning creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and The One Ring to quickly ramp up mana, search for key lands, and create a powerful board presence. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently while utilizing lands such as Urza's Saga, Boseiju, Who Endures, and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to gain additional advantage. The inclusion of cards like Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Arboreal Grazer help to accelerate the deck's game plan, while cards like Cultivator Colossus and Expedition Map provide additional support and utility.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using powerful artifacts and lands to ramp into big threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck utilizes the UrzaTron lands to quickly assemble mana for its high-cost spells and uses cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Oblivion Stone to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes utility spells like Relic of Progenitus and Dismember to interact with the opponent's graveyard and creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overpower the opponent with its big threats and resource denial.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a variety of spells and powerful creatures. It utilizes a combination of removal spells like Solitude, Prismatic Ending, and Lightning Bolt, along with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Nissa, Resurgent Animist to dominate the board. With cards like Omnath, Locus of Creation providing additional advantage and card draw engines like Preordain, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent until it can establish a dominant position and secure the win.

The deck focuses on utilizing The Underworld Cookbook and other artifacts to generate value and disrupt the opponent while combining aggro elements to apply pressure and close out games quickly. Ovalchase Daredevil and Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar provide strong threats, supported by cards like Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble to keep the engine going. Syr Ginger, the Meal Ender offers a powerful finisher, while cards like Wrenn and Six provide additional value. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of disruptive artifacts and aggressive creatures, ultimately leading to victory.

The deck focuses on quickly casting Cascade spells to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells. By efficiently cascading into high-impact cards like Crashing Footfalls and Violent Outburst, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and disruption to control the game's pace. The inclusion of cards like Shardless Agent and Dead / Gone allows for flexibility and adaptability in different matchups, while cards like Force of Negation and Mystical Dispute provide crucial protection against opposing spells. Additionally, the deck utilizes a mix of lands to ensure consistent mana production and support its aggressive game plan.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of attaching Colossus Hammer to a creature, usually Puresteel Paladin, to deal a large amount of damage in one swing. Stoneforge Mystic and Urza's Saga help tutor for the necessary pieces, while Esper Sentinel and Giver of Runes provide protection and card advantage. The deck can also combo off with Forge Anew to put powerful equipment like Kaldra Compleat into play. The strategy relies on a fast and explosive win condition, overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to react.

This deck focuses on utilizing +1/+1 counters and modular abilities to quickly build up a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. Creatures like Zabaz, the Glimmerwasp and Walking Ballista benefit from Hardened Scales and can quickly grow in power. The inclusion of artifact synergies like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Arcbound Ravager enhances the deck's ability to continuously pump out threats and put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes various tools for protection and versatility, such as Aether Spellbomb and The Ozolith.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and use cards like Goryo's Vengeance or Ephemerate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a big advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Grief and Tainted Indulgence to disrupt your opponent's game plan while you set up your combo. By utilizing instant reanimation, card draw, and removal spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and control the game's tempo.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a blend of removal spells, disruption, and powerful creatures. It utilizes the Jund color combination to control the board and put pressure on opponents with cards like Tarmogoyf and Wrenn and Six. The inclusion of the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring adds consistency to the deck. The deck also takes advantage of land-based synergy with cards like Elvish Reclaimer and Urza's Saga. Overall, the deck aims to quickly close out games through a combination of efficient threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing Martyr of Sands' ability to gain a large amount of life and then using that life total as a resource to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The deck includes cards that can exile threats, protect the player's life total, and control the opponent's board state. The goal is to establish a strong board presence and grind out the opponent through efficient creatures and removal spells while staying ahead on life total. The deck also includes some land destruction elements to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This deck focuses on quickly applying pressure to the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler. It aims to control the game with counterspells and removal like Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt while generating card advantage with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration. The deck also utilizes the graveyard with cards like Murktide Regent and Tarmogoyf. The mana base is optimized for consistent casting of spells and includes utility lands like Otawara, Soaring City. Overall, the deck seeks to win the game quickly through a combination of tempo and card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly and aggressively playing powerful threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Counterspell and Unholy Heat. It also utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to generate card advantage and maintain tempo. The deck aims to control the board and pressure the opponent's life total to secure a win in the early to mid game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, disruptive cards, and powerful creatures to dominate the battlefield. It aims to efficiently answer threats while establishing its own board presence with versatile cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Omnath, Locus of Creation. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting its spells, allowing it to adapt to various situations and outmaneuver opponents through strategic decision-making and resource management.

The deck focuses on utilizing primeval titan and amulet of vigor to generate lots of mana and play multiple lands per turn. With the bounce lands and utility lands, the deck aims to quickly assemble the Tron-like land combo, allowing for explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats like the One Ring and Cultivator Colossus. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Expedition Map and Summoner's Pact to search for key pieces and maintain consistency. Overall, the deck aims to ramp quickly and overwhelm the opponent with big threats and land synergies.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to cheat out powerful land-based threats, such as Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus. The key synergy lies in utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor and The One Ring to untap lands multiple times in a turn, allowing for explosive plays. The deck also utilizes Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifacts and lands, while leveraging utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle for additional value. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large creatures and powerful land interactions.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells with cascade abilities to generate value and overwhelm the opponent with threats. By cascading into cards like Crashing Footfalls or Violent Outburst, the deck can flood the board with creatures and put pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety help to protect the deck's game plan while maintaining aggression. The land base includes a mix of fetch lands and utility lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creatures with enter-the-battlefield abilities in combination with Yawgmoth, Thran Physician to create a powerful creature toolbox. By sacrificing creatures to Yawgmoth's ability, the deck can generate card advantage, removal, and create a swarm of creatures. The deck also features tutors like Chord of Calling and Eldritch Evolution to search for key creatures in the deck. The strategy revolves around building a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's board and gaining incremental advantages through sacrificing and recurring creatures.

This deck focuses on using a variety of creature cards to create combos and synergies to control the board and outvalue opponents. By utilizing creatures like Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons, Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, and Grist, the Hunger Tide, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantages. The toolbox nature of the deck allows for flexibility in finding the right creatures for any situation using cards like Chord of Calling and Eldritch Evolution. This deck excels in adapting to different matchups and maintaining board presence through a toolbox of creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly reducing its own life total to benefit from cards like Death's Shadow and Not Dead After All, all while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Grief. The goal is to apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Stalactite Stalker and Dauthi Voidwalker, controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch. The deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with its aggressive creatures and disruption spells.

The key focus of this deck is to quickly mill cards from your library into your graveyard, enabling you to trigger powerful graveyard recursion effects. By utilizing cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug to dredge and fill your graveyard, you can bring back creatures like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam for explosive board presence. Additionally, cards like Creeping Chill provide incidental damage to your opponent while you set up your graveyard combos. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a flurry of undead creatures and graveyard shenanigans.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Atraxa, using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to do so. It also includes disruptive elements like Grief and Solitude to control the opponent's resources. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful threats, utilizing instant-speed interactions to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can establish their own strategy or answer the threats presented.

This deck focuses on quickly and efficiently reanimating powerful creatures such as Griselbrand and Atraxa using spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Tainted Indulgence. Fallgaji Archaeologist and Ephemerate provide additional synergy and value, while disruption is added with cards like Grief and Thoughtseize. The mana base is a mix of fetchlands, shocklands, and utility lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting the spells needed for the combo to go off. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly cycle through cards in order to get key combo pieces into the graveyard, such as Street Wraith and Architect of Will, and then use cards like Violent Outburst and Living End to bring all creatures back from the graveyard to the battlefield. This deck relies on speed and efficiency to overwhelm the opponent with a board full of creatures, creating a powerful combo that can win the game in just a few turns. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation to protect the combo and control the opponent's plays.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a board full of Merfolk creatures with buffs from Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, supported by disruptive spells like Merfolk Trickster and Force of Negation. The key strategy is to control the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent with powerful Merfolk synergies and tempo plays. The inclusion of cards like Glasspool Mimic and Svyelun of Sea and Sky adds versatility and card advantage to ensure the deck maintains pressure and consistency throughout the game.

This Merfolk deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a mix of disruptive creatures and lords that boost each other's power and toughness. Using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Force of Negation to counter key spells, the deck can outpace and outmaneuver the opponent. By taking advantage of tribal synergies and disruptive abilities like tapping down opposing creatures, the deck aims to win the game as efficiently as possible while controlling the battlefield.

This Modern UB Mill deck focuses on quickly filling your opponent's graveyard and then using cards like Archive Trap and Fractured Sanity to mill them out, forcing them to draw from an empty library. The deck includes a variety of mill cards like Hedron Crab and Ruin Crab, along with disruption spells like Drown in the Loch and Fatal Push to control the board. Surgical Extraction helps to remove key cards from your opponent's graveyard, while Visions of Beyond provides card draw to help fuel your mill strategy. With efficient mill cards and disruptive spells, this deck aims to win through milling out the opponent's deck.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to have a fast-paced aggressive strategy using efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Murktide Regent, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Counterspell and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to control the board with a mix of removal and counter spells, while also maintaining card advantage through cantrips like Mishra's Bauble and Preordain. By applying early pressure and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on control and utilizing the UrzaTron lands to generate massive amounts of mana quickly. It includes counterspells and bounce effects to disrupt the opponent's game plan, along with a variety of utility lands to further enhance control. Karn, the Great Creator serves as a versatile threat and toolbox, able to fetch important artifacts like Oblivion Stone or Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through efficient removal, counterspells, and powerful threats generated by the UrzaTron lands.

This deck focuses on using a combination of efficient removal spells, disruptive cards, and powerful creatures to quickly apply pressure and overwhelm the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Grief, while also having strong threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco to close out the game quickly. The deck also uses Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding to protect its creatures and maintain board control. Additionally, the deck includes versatile lands to provide access to a variety of colors for its spells.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with aggressive creatures like Nishoba Brawler, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Scion of Draco, supported by efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames. The deck also utilizes Leyline cards to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional flexibility and mana ramp. Overall, this aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast threats and efficient interaction in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on a aggressive playstyle, aiming to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a variety of aggressive creatures and spells. By utilizing a combination of powerful creatures like Nishoba Brawler and Wild Nacatl, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and deal damage quickly. The inclusion of Leyline cards and a unique companion choice in Jegantha, the Wellspring, adds additional layers of strategy and versatility to the deck.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using efficient removal spells to quickly control the battlefield and deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds extra versatility to the deck. With a mix of powerful creatures like Scion of Draco and efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and efficient removal. Leyline cards provide additional protection and synergy within the deck, allowing for explosive turns and unexpected plays.

The deck aims to quickly ramp into Primeval Titan using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove, while utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate mana efficiently. The key cards include The One Ring, which can provide additional land drops and power up the titans, as well as Urza's Saga for tutor capabilities. With the ability to play multiple lands per turn and access to powerful utility lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, the deck can quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with massive threats.

The key concept of this Amulet Titan deck is to use lands and creatures to generate explosive mana ramp and combo off with Primeval Titan to quickly search out key lands and win conditions. The deck utilizes the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and the bounce lands to generate large amounts of mana and allows for explosive plays with Primeval Titan to quickly close out games. The inclusion of The One Ring provides additional utility and versatility in the deck's strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands and ramp to quickly play and abuse Primeval Titan, generating immense value and explosive finishes with powerful land interactions such as The One Ring, Urza's Saga, and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. It also includes tools like Amulet of Vigor and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to accelerate mana production and facilitate big plays. The overall strategy revolves around combining land and creature synergies to create a dominant board presence and overwhelm the opponent with overwhelming threats and combos.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently ramp up mana and tutor for key pieces to quickly assemble the combo of Primeval Titan, Amulet of Vigor, and The One Ring. By utilizing lands like Urza's Saga and multiple bounce lands, the deck aims to generate a large amount of mana and tutor for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive amounts of damage quickly. The deck also includes Cultivator Colossus for additional ramp and finisher potential, making it a powerful combo deck in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently with low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. By constantly applying pressure to the opponent's life total, the deck aims to win before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Roiling Vortex and Boros Charm adds versatility and resilience to the strategy, allowing the deck to adapt to different situations and protect its threats. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for casting spells efficiently.

This deck focuses on utilizing Cascade mechanics to quickly put pressure on opponents with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with counter spells and bounce effects. It aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of threats and tempo plays, utilizing the Cascade mechanic to cheat out powerful cards for free and maintain a constant stream of pressure. The inclusion of versatile spells and lands allows for flexibility and adaptability in different matchups, ensuring the deck can handle a variety of threats and strategies effectively.

This deck utilizes a toolbox of creatures with various abilities to combo off and control the board. Yawgmoth, Thran Physician is central to the combo game plan, allowing for card draw and creature removal. Cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Agatha's Soul Cauldron provide additional value and synergy with the creatures in the deck. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive plays, while also being able to search for specific creatures using spells like Chord of Calling and Eldritch Evolution.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures to create powerful synergies and combos. By utilizing cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Delighted Halfling, as well as toolbox creatures like Wall of Roots and Blood Artist, the player can control the board and drain their opponent's life total. With the help of cards like Chord of Calling and Grist, the Hunger Tide, the player can tutor for specific creatures to fit the situation. The deck also includes disruption and mana acceleration with cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Ignoble Hierarch.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of cards that focus on creativity and turning the opponent's resources against them. By employing cards like Indomitable Creativity and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, the player can disrupt the opponent's plans and gain a strategic advantage. Additionally, the deck includes control elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending to further manipulate the game state in their favor. The goal is to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory through clever plays and efficient card interactions.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, Indomitable Creativity, and Leyline Binding to generate powerful effects and overwhelm the opponent. It incorporates a mix of control elements like Lightning Bolt, Spell Pierce, and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes ways to tutor for key pieces, such as Transmogrify and Prismari Command. The mana base is diverse, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and ensuring consistency in executing the combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Colossus Hammer combo using Puresteel Paladin, Stoneforge Mystic, and Sigarda's Aid to equip Colossus Hammer onto a creature for a massive damage output. Urza's Saga can tutor for key pieces of the combo, while Esper Sentinel and Shadowspear provide additional support and disruption. The addition of Forge Anew allows for potential big plays by bringing back artifacts from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful and fast combo strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Solitude. It also utilizes cards like Fallaji Archaeologist to bring back key pieces from the graveyard. Tainted Indulgence helps to filter through the deck for combo pieces, while Ephemerate and Faithful Mending provide additional utility and card advantage. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing Atraxa's abilities to generate additional value. Overall, the deck relies on a fast and efficient reanimation strategy to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Tainted Indulgence. A combination of instant spells and creature abilities allows for a fast and efficient reanimation strategy, with cards like Fallaji Archaeologist providing extra graveyard recursion. Control elements like Grief and Solitude help disrupt opponents while allowing the deck to set up its combo plays. The deck's mana base is carefully constructed to support the combo pieces and ensure consistent reanimation of creatures each game.

This deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Tainted Indulgence. The key strategy is to combo off by reanimating creatures like Griselbrand or Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while controlling the board with cards like Solitude and Force of Negation. Teferi, Time Raveler helps protect and set up the combo, while Faithful Mending and Ephemerate provide value and card selection. The deck aims to disrupt opponents while rapidly assembling the combo pieces to overwhelm them with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing a mix of removal, hand disruption and efficient creatures to put constant pressure on the opponent. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Terminate, and Fatal Push, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Wrenn and Six to quickly close out the game. The inclusion of Mishra's Research Desk and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker adds a unique twist to the aggressive strategy, giving the deck some additional versatility and card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive gameplay while still providing the necessary colors for the deck's spells.

This deck aims to quickly cycle through and discard a combination of creatures with high mana costs to then cast Living End and bring them back onto the battlefield, overwhelming the opponent with a sudden surge of powerful threats. The deck includes cards that allow for efficient cycling and graveyard filling, while also containing disruptive elements to control the opponent's game plan. The goal is to execute the Living End combo as quickly and consistently as possible to secure victory before the opponent can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on casting Living End to bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard while disrupting opponent's strategies with counterspells and hand disruption. It also utilizes Cascade to cast spells without having to pay their mana cost, allowing for a quick and effective combo. The deck includes creatures with abilities that can be beneficial both on the battlefield and in the graveyard, creating a versatile and resilient strategy. Additionally, the lands in the deck provide a mix of colored mana sources to support the deck's casting requirements.

The deck focuses on cycling creatures into the graveyard to then use Living End to bring them back onto the battlefield all at once, overwhelming the opponent with a massive board presence. The deck includes a variety of creatures with cycling abilities to facilitate this strategy, along with cards like Shardless Agent and Force of Negation to control the game until the combo can be executed. The deck also includes some evasion abilities and card draw to help maintain momentum and ensure the combo can be pulled off successfully.

The deck focuses on using cards like Grief and Subtlety to disrupt the opponent's hand and board while cycling through the deck with cards like Architects of Will and Street Wraith. The goal is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures and then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield, overwhelming the opponent with a massive army. The deck also includes cards like Force of Negation and Violent Outburst to protect the combo and ensure it goes off smoothly.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the graveyard with cards like Life from the Loam and Underworld Breach to generate value and fuel the aggro strategy. Key components include powerful creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, as well as utility cards like Mishra's Bauble and Wrenn and Six. The deck also features mana acceleration with Mox Amber and Urza's Saga, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Flame Slash. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck.

This Merfolk aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, while disrupting opponent's plans with counterspells like Force of Negation and Subtlety. Aether Vial helps cheat creatures into play, and utility lands like Mutavault and Cavern of Souls ensure a smooth mana base. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of Merfolk creatures, backed up by disruptive spells to protect its own game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements to protect and amplify the power of The One Ring. Through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and versatile creatures, the pilot can establish a dominant position while slowly building up towards the powerful artifact. With a mix of powerful planeswalkers and versatile creatures, the deck can control the board state and disrupt opponent's strategies, allowing the pilot to slowly grind out a victory with The One Ring as the centerpiece of the strategy.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal while deploying aggressive threats to quickly close out the game. By utilizing efficient card draw and selection spells like Expressive Iteration and Preordain, it aims to maintain tempo and apply pressure. The mix of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Murktide Regent, along with disruptive spells like Lightning Bolt and Counterspell, creates a versatile and powerful strategy that can adapt to various matchups in the Modern format. The deck's mana base supports its spells and creatures, enabling a consistent and aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Murktide Regent to put pressure on the opponent. It also includes disruptive spells like Counterspell and Unholy Heat to control the board and protect your creatures. The deck aims to quickly close out the game by efficiently using card advantage and filtering through the deck with cards like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble. The mana base is designed to support a fast tempo playstyle with access to both red and blue mana sources.

The deck focuses on ramping into powerful, game-ending threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Karn, the Great Creator using the UrzaTron lands. It also includes control elements like Oblivion Stone and All Is Dust to deal with opposing threats, as well as utility cards like Sylvan Scrying and Ancient Stirrings to find key pieces. The deck aims to create a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to victory through overwhelming power and flexibility.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of colorless mana quickly. It utilizes control elements such as Karn, the Great Creator and Oblivion Stone to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying large threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes ways to tutor for key pieces like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying, ensuring consistent access to the UrzaTron lands. Additionally, there are cards like Relic of Progenitus to disrupt graveyard strategies and generate card advantage.
